page.title: 12FARMING AROUND CRANFIELD.
page.content: { Farmland }in the area is arable, basically winter wheat. The secon- dary crop is winter barley. Because the soil is cretaceous clay and only grade 3 the wheat and barley go for animal feeds. A very small proportion of top grade wheat is used for flour. Rye is sold to Ovaltine to be used in drinks. Some beans are used for Frankfurter sau- sages and others are used for pigeon feed. Peas are dried and used as they are. The oil-seed rape is sold for margerine and cooking oil. Farming has changed in this area over the last few decades from mixed farming and market gardening to arable farms and sheep farms. The countryside has altered from small fields with hedge bounderies to larger fields.
